text: Very interesting. I'll do some tests. Thanks for your input Carter.
No, what I want is to have the “secrets” field directly inside my own application form. For the moment I have to set my api key manually (in Clé API)
Hello <@U01QVR44MEY>, I have the same question !
<@U04F6R2T1PC> and <@U04G551EYHZ> currently this isn't possible, it might become possible in a couple of months because the team is changing how some of the inputs work
of course, let me know how it goes

Thanks for your reply <@U01QVR44MEY> !

Do you have a workarround ?
the only solution found is to add the API key in a plain input text ?

Currently it's not a very good workaround, it looks like having the user input the secrets in the signup flow and then you use a select field with optionsUrl to pull in those secrets and allow the user to select one of them
This approach require you to build out a frontend and then store the secrets in your database, so again not the best solution but it does work pretty well

Thanks for your time

If I understood correctly you propose to save the couple HubSpot-userId / API Key in our database while adding the native app to the client’s account (signup process) ?

So :
- build a frontend form to handle the API Key submit in redirect page and save it in our database
- in all request, retrieve the API Key in our database based on the HubSpot-user-id

Do we have the same HubSpot-userId in all workflows ?
Yes the workflow will send over the account id and that is what will be stored in the database

I'm also having this issue with a custom email module.
Have you solved it <@U02J1440N13> ?
